craterdog.notary

Interface Notarization

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    V1NotarizationProvider

    public interface Notarization
    This interface defines the methods that must be implemented by all based digital notaries.
    Author:
    Derk Norton

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int VALID_FOR_FOREVER
      For a notary seal that never expires.
      static int VALID_FOR_ONE_DAY
      For a notary seal that expires after one day.
      static int VALID_FOR_ONE_HOUR
      For a notary seal that expires after one hour.
      static int VALID_FOR_ONE_MINUTE
      For a notary seal that expires after one minute.
      static int VALID_FOR_ONE_MONTH
      For a notary seal that expires after one month (30 days).
      static int VALID_FOR_ONE_WEEK
      For a notary seal that expires after one week.
      static int VALID_FOR_ONE_YEAR
      For a notary seal that expires after one year.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      NotaryKey deserializeNotaryKey(String json, char[] password)
      This method de-serializes, from a JSON string, a notary key using the specified password to decrypt the signing key.
      DocumentCitation generateDocumentCitation(URI location, String document)
      This method generates a new citation using the specified location URI and document content.
      NotaryKey generateNotaryKey(URI baseUri)
      This method generates a new notary key consisting of an asymmetric (public/private) key pair based on the algorithm implemented by the specific notary implementation.
      NotaryKey generateNotaryKey(URI baseUri, Map<String,Object> additionalAttributes)
      This method generates a new notary key consisting of an asymmetric (public/private) key pair based on the algorithm implemented by the specific notary implementation.
      NotaryKey generateNotaryKey(URI baseUri, Map<String,Object> additionalAttributes, NotaryKey previousKey)
      This method generates a new notary key consisting of an asymmetric (public/private) key pair based on the algorithm implemented by the specific notary implementation.
      NotaryKey generateNotaryKey(URI baseUri, NotaryKey previousKey)
      This method generates a new notary key consisting of an asymmetric (public/private) key pair based on the algorithm implemented by the specific notary implementation.
      Watermark generateWatermark(int secondsToLive)
      This method generates a watermark defining the lifetime of a new document as well as the version of the algorithm used to sign and verify the document.
      NotarySeal notarizeDocument(String documentType, String document, NotaryKey notaryKey)
      This method generates a digital seal from the specified document using the specified private notary key.
      String serializeNotaryKey(NotaryKey notaryKey, char[] password)
      This method serializes, as a JSON string, the specified notary key encrypting the private signing key using the specified password.
      void throwExceptionOnErrors(String messageTag, Map<String,Object> errors)
      This method checks to see if there are any errors and throws a validation exception containing the errors if there are.
      void validateDocument(String document, NotarySeal seal, NotaryCertificate certificate, Map<String,Object> errors)
      This method uses the specified public verification key to verify that the specified digital seal is valid for the specified document.
      void validateDocumentCitation(DocumentCitation citation, String document, Map<String,Object> errors)
      This method checks to see if the specified citation is valid.
      void validateNotaryCertificate(NotaryCertificate certificate, NotaryCertificate previousCertificate, Map<String,Object> errors)
      This method validates a notary certificate using the previous notary certificate associated with the notary key that certified it.
      void validateWatermark(Watermark watermark, Map<String,Object> errors)
      This method checks to see if the watermark is still valid.

    • Method Detail

      • generateWatermark

        Watermark generateWatermark(int secondsToLive)
        This method generates a watermark defining the lifetime of a new document as well as the version of the algorithm used to sign and verify the document.
        Parameters:
        secondsToLive - The number of seconds the document should be valid from the current date and time.
        Returns:
        The newly generated watermark.

      • validateWatermark

        void validateWatermark(Watermark watermark,
                       Map<String,Object> errors)
        This method checks to see if the watermark is still valid.
        Parameters:
        watermark - The watermark to be validated.
        errors - A map containing any errors that were found.

      • generateDocumentCitation

        DocumentCitation generateDocumentCitation(URI location,
                                          String document)
        This method generates a new citation using the specified location URI and document content.
        Parameters:
        location - The location of the cited document.
        document - The document being cited.
        Returns:
        A new citation referring to the document.

      • validateDocumentCitation

        void validateDocumentCitation(DocumentCitation citation,
                              String document,
                              Map<String,Object> errors)
        This method checks to see if the specified citation is valid.
        Parameters:
        citation - The citation to be validated.
        document - The document referenced by the citation.
        errors - A map containing any errors that were found.

      • generateNotaryKey

        NotaryKey generateNotaryKey(URI baseUri)
        This method generates a new notary key consisting of an asymmetric (public/private) key pair based on the algorithm implemented by the specific notary implementation.
        Parameters:
        baseUri - The location of the identity registry that will manage the certificates.
        Returns:
        The newly generated notary key.

      • generateNotaryKey

        NotaryKey generateNotaryKey(URI baseUri,
                            Map<String,Object> additionalAttributes)
        This method generates a new notary key consisting of an asymmetric (public/private) key pair based on the algorithm implemented by the specific notary implementation.
        Parameters:
        baseUri - The location of the identity registry that will manage the certificates.
        additionalAttributes - Any additional attributes about the notary key.
        Returns:
        The newly generated notary key.

      • generateNotaryKey

        NotaryKey generateNotaryKey(URI baseUri,
                            NotaryKey previousKey)
        This method generates a new notary key consisting of an asymmetric (public/private) key pair based on the algorithm implemented by the specific notary implementation.
        Parameters:
        baseUri - The location of the identity registry that will manage the certificates.
        previousKey - The previous notary, if one exists, or null if this is the first in the chain.
        Returns:
        The newly generated notary key.

      • generateNotaryKey

        NotaryKey generateNotaryKey(URI baseUri,
                            Map<String,Object> additionalAttributes,
                            NotaryKey previousKey)
        This method generates a new notary key consisting of an asymmetric (public/private) key pair based on the algorithm implemented by the specific notary implementation.
        Parameters:
        baseUri - The location of the identity registry that will manage the certificates.
        additionalAttributes - Any additional attributes about the notary key.
        previousKey - The previous notary, if one exists, or null if this is the first in the chain.
        Returns:
        The newly generated notary key.

      • serializeNotaryKey

        String serializeNotaryKey(NotaryKey notaryKey,
                          char[] password)
        This method serializes, as a JSON string, the specified notary key encrypting the private signing key using the specified password.
        Parameters:
        notaryKey - The notary key to be serialized.
        password - The password to be used to encrypt the signing key.
        Returns:
        A JSON string representing the notary key.

      • deserializeNotaryKey

        NotaryKey deserializeNotaryKey(String json,
                               char[] password)
                        throws IOException
        This method de-serializes, from a JSON string, a notary key using the specified password to decrypt the signing key.
        Parameters:
        json - The JSON string representing the notary key.
        password - The password to be used to decrypt the signing key.
        Returns:
        The reconstituted notary key.
        Throws:
        IOException - The notary key could not be deserialized.

      • validateNotaryCertificate

        void validateNotaryCertificate(NotaryCertificate certificate,
                               NotaryCertificate previousCertificate,
                               Map<String,Object> errors)
        This method validates a notary certificate using the previous notary certificate associated with the notary key that certified it.
        Parameters:
        certificate - The notary certificate to be validated.
        previousCertificate - The notary certificate for the notary key that certified it.
        errors - A map containing any errors that were found.

      • notarizeDocument

        NotarySeal notarizeDocument(String documentType,
                            String document,
                            NotaryKey notaryKey)
        This method generates a digital seal from the specified document using the specified private notary key.
        Parameters:
        documentType - The type of document being notarized.
        document - The document to be notarized.
        notaryKey - The notary key used to notarize the document.
        Returns:
        The newly generated digital seal.

      • validateDocument

        void validateDocument(String document,
                      NotarySeal seal,
                      NotaryCertificate certificate,
                      Map<String,Object> errors)
        This method uses the specified public verification key to verify that the specified digital seal is valid for the specified document.
        Parameters:
        document - The notarized document to be verified.
        seal - The digital seal for the document.
        certificate - The verification certificate of the notary that signed the document.
        errors - A map containing any errors that were found.

      • throwExceptionOnErrors

        void throwExceptionOnErrors(String messageTag,
                            Map<String,Object> errors)
                     throws ValidationException
        This method checks to see if there are any errors and throws a validation exception containing the errors if there are.
        Parameters:
        messageTag - The message resource tag for the validation exception.
        errors - The map of errors (and empty map means no errors).
        Throws:
        ValidationException - There were errors in the errors map.
